metadata.purpose: The Client Onboarding process establishes the formal banking relationship between the organization and new BizBanking clients. Its primary purpose is to verify client identity, assess risk, and set up the appropriate accounts and products while ensuring full compliance with regulatory requirements including KYC and AML obligations. A secondary purpose is risk management â€” ensuring only clients meeting the bank's risk appetite are onboarded.
metadata.trigger: The process is initiated when a prospective BizBanking client expresses intent to establish a banking relationship. Primary triggers include: direct client inquiry, RM-initiated acquisition, referrals from existing clients/partners, or product upgrades from retail to BizBanking segment. The formal process begins when the RM creates a new client record in the CRM.
metadata.frequency: Continuous, demand-driven basis with no fixed schedule. Cases processed daily by Compliance and Operations teams. Approvals within SLA windows (same-day or next-day). Peak periods at month-end and quarter-end.
metadata.volume: Monthly: 40-60 new onboardings. Weekly average: 10-15 cases in processing. Active pipeline: 25-35 cases at any time. Distribution: 70% standard, 25% enhanced due diligence, 5% complex/high-risk. Peak capacity: ~80 cases/month.

process_steps.name: Initial Client Contact
process_steps.rationale: Capture client interest and basic information

process_steps.name: AML Screening
process_steps.rationale: Screen against sanctions and PEP lists

process_steps.name: Account Setup
process_steps.rationale: Create accounts in core banking system

process_steps.name: Welcome & Handover
process_steps.rationale: Complete onboarding and handover to BAU

process_exceptions.name: Incomplete Documentation
process_exceptions.trigger: Client unable to provide required documents
process_exceptions.handling: RM follows up with client, provides checklist, sets deadline. If not resolved in 10 days, case is paused.

process_exceptions.name: Failed KYC Verification
process_exceptions.trigger: Identity verification fails or documents invalid
process_exceptions.handling: Case returned to RM for re-collection. If repeated failure, escalate to Compliance Manager for decision.

process_exceptions.name: AML/Sanctions Hit
process_exceptions.trigger: Client matches sanctions list or PEP database
process_exceptions.handling: Immediate escalation to Compliance Leadership. Case frozen pending investigation. Potential regulatory reporting required.

process_exceptions.name: High-Risk Client Escalation
process_exceptions.handling: Case routed to Senior Compliance Officer or Risk Committee based on rating. Enhanced due diligence documentation required.

process_exceptions.name: System Downtime
process_exceptions.trigger: Core Banking or KYC Platform unavailable
process_exceptions.handling: Cases queued for processing when system restored. Client notified of delay. Manual workarounds for critical cases only.

process_exceptions.name: Product Not Available
process_exceptions.trigger: Requested product not available for client type
process_exceptions.handling: Onboarding Specialist proposes alternatives. RM discusses with client. Proceed with available products or defer activation.

pain_points.name: Document Chase
pain_points.description: RMs spend 30%+ of time chasing clients for documents, delaying onboarding and reducing capacity for new business acquisition.
pain_points.impact: RMs spend 30%+ of time chasing clients for documents
pain_points.root_cause: No automated document checklist or reminder system; reliance on manual follow-ups

pain_points.name: Manual Data Re-entry
pain_points.description: Same client data entered 3x across CRM, KYC Platform, and Core Banking with no system integration.
pain_points.impact: Triple data entry creates errors, delays, and staff frustration
pain_points.root_cause: Systems not integrated; no master data management

pain_points.name: KYC Platform Slowness
pain_points.description: System response times of 10-15 seconds per screen impacting Compliance Officer productivity.
pain_points.impact: Compliance processing takes 2x longer than necessary due to system lag

pain_points.name: Unclear Handoff Points
pain_points.description: No formal handoff notification between RM and Compliance; Compliance checks queue manually.
pain_points.impact: Cases sit idle awaiting pickup; average 4-hour delay at handoff
pain_points.root_cause: No workflow automation; manual queue management

pain_points.name: Risk Rating Subjectivity
pain_points.description: Different Compliance Officers rate the same client profile differently due to lack of standardized criteria.
pain_points.impact: Inconsistent risk decisions; potential compliance and audit issues
pain_points.root_cause: No standardized scoring matrix; reliance on individual judgment

pain_points.name: SLA Tracking Manual
pain_points.description: No automated SLA dashboard; Excel spreadsheet used for tracking case timelines.
pain_points.impact: Unable to identify at-risk cases proactively; SLA breaches discovered late
pain_points.root_cause: No workflow management system; manual tracking in spreadsheets

pain_points.name: Client Communication Gaps
pain_points.description: Clients not proactively updated on application status between milestones.
pain_points.impact: Client frustration; increased inbound inquiries to RMs
pain_points.root_cause: No automated status notifications; manual client updates only

pain_points.name: No Client Portal
pain_points.description: Clients have no self-service portal to track their onboarding status, upload documents, or communicate with the bank. All interactions require manual coordination through email and phone calls with the Relationship Manager.
pain_points.impact: Clients cannot self-serve for document uploads or status checks, resulting in high RM workload for routine inquiries, delayed document collection, poor client experience during onboarding, and competitive disadvantage against banks offering digital onboarding capabilities.
pain_points.root_cause: No digital client-facing platform; reliance on manual email and phone interactions

controls.name: KYC Verification Check
controls.description: Verify client identity against provided documentation and regulatory requirements

controls.name: AML/Sanctions Screening
controls.description: Screen client against global sanctions lists, PEP databases, and adverse media

controls.name: Risk Rating Approval
controls.description: Assign and approve risk rating based on client profile and due diligence findings

controls.name: Four-Eyes Account Setup
controls.description: Require second person review/approval for account creation in Core Banking

controls.name: Final Onboarding Approval
controls.description: Management sign-off required before client activation and product enablement

controls.name: Document Authenticity Check
controls.description: Verify authenticity of submitted documents using validation tools and manual review

controls.name: PEP Enhanced Due Diligence
controls.description: Enhanced due diligence procedures for Politically Exposed Persons including source of wealth verification

controls.name: Audit Trail Logging
controls.description: Complete audit trail of all actions, decisions, and approvals throughout the onboarding process
